column1: short and wide ball, stays in the crease and crunches it through covers for four
good length ball, defended back to the bowler
overpitched ball, comes down the crease and blocks it to mid-on
full and wide outside off, presses forward to drive and skews it off the inside part of the bat back to the bowler
slower length ball, gets an outside edge and the ball goes on the bounce to the wicketkeeper
short and wide outside off, Kamran crunches it through cover-point and the ball races to the boundary
good length ball, cramps Kamran for room and the ball is defended into the off side
length ball on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
short and wide ball, tries to fetch a pull from outside off and mistimes it. Ends up dragging it towards mid-on
length ball, swinging back in sharply, Akmal swings and misses and the wicketkeeper flings himself to his left and misses the ball as well
short of a length, knocks it to mid-on for a quick single and keeps the strike
short of a length, angling into the pads, tucked to midwicket
comes down the track and plays it to mid-on
short of a length, angling in on leg, swivels around and pulls to backward square leg
short ball, angling in on leg again and this time it's slower in pace and the batsman does not make contact as he tries to pull it
back of a length and angling in, tucked with the angle to square leg
too short and a little too straight. Not much pace and sits up nicely, Kamran swivels around and pulls it away to deep backward square leg
comes forward and tries to flick this into the leg side but there is a lot of turn and he misses the ball. The ball spins in sharply and it is hard for the wicketkeeper to get his hands to it
flat length ball at pace outside off, comes forward and defends back to the bowler
tossed up on off, clipped off the pads to midwicket. They think of the second but decide against it as the ball is picked up

flat, short and wide outside off, rocks back and cuts in front of point. They set off for a quick single and backward point runs across and fields it. Fires a throw at the bowler's end and Narine opts to not get behind the stumps and let the ball hit the stumps. Except that it does not and they take the overthrow
fuller ball, comes forward and drives through covers
Narine fires a tempter outside off and the batsman comes forward. Does not get to the pitch of this length ball and gets an outside edge as the ball goes to the third man boundary
length ball on leg stump, tries to flick it into the leg side and gets an inside edge to the pads
short of a length, sitting up nicely, swivels around and pulls through deep backward square leg
width on offer outside off, waits for it at the crease and opens the face of his bat before steering it away to square third man
short of a length on leg stump, tries to pull it away fine and gets it off the inside edge to the thigh as the ball rolls away fine
good length ball, angled across the right-hander on off-stump channel, Kamran presses forward and defends with bat close to pad
poor delivery. Short ball down the leg side, no pace and not much bounce, pulled away. Fine leg is inside the circle and the ball will comfortably beat him to the boundary
tries to steer this short of a length ball away but cannot beat short third man
rapped on the pads. appeal for lbw but turned down. Nicely flighted fullish ball, tries to flick it away but there is sharp turn in to the right-hander. Seems like impact was outside off
hops back and tucks it into the midwicket region
width on offer outside off, crunches a drive to covers
flat length ball, just outside off, deftly played by Kamran. Beautiful late use of the wrists, cuts it well wide of the first slip fielder and the ball goes to the third man boundary
drags it wider outside off this time and it is slapped out to deep point
pitched up on leg stump, driven to covers where McCullum puts in a dive to stop it

beautifully done. Goes for an expansive drive but this one spins away a mile and comfortably beats the outside edge of the flashing blade. The wicketkeeper takes off the bails and makes an excited appeal for stumped. The foot did go up momentarily but he has planted it back in by the time the bails are whipped off
comes forward to this fuller ball that is sliding in and pushes it down to long-off
floated up outside off, driven off the front foot to covers and McCullum at short cover is at it again, flings himself to his left and stops it

bowled him. Hafeez attempts a cheeky paddle sweep after going across and he has lost his leg stump. And Peshawar have lost their second wicket. It pitched outside leg and Hafeez exposed the leg stick. He fails to make contact on the sweep and the stump is uprooted
opens the bat face with soft hands and works it wide of short third man
width on offer outside off and he has split the gap with surgical precision. Opens the bat face and plays a late cut that goes between backward point and short third man
fuller ball at 107.9 kph on off, driven to sweeper cover
good length ball outside off, strides forward and opens the bat face to steer it to backward point
fullish ball, drilled down to long-on where the fielder runs to his left and picks it up
fullish length ball, not much pace again and it is eased down to long-on
short and wide outside off, cuts but does not get it off the middle of the bat and chops it to covers

gets down to sweep early and the ball is on a length and on the leg stump channel. The ball is swept to to backward square leg where Yamin makes a mess of it. runs across and rolls down to his left but lets the ball go from between his legs. Slightly over-ran it
swept towards fine leg where the fielder covers it just fine this time and will keep it to two
swept out to deep fine leg again
short ball, flat trajectory and spinning away, tries to pull it away and ends up dragging it down to long-on
short and some width on offer outside off, cut out to deep point where sweeper cover runs across and fields it
pitched up on leg, comes forward and pushes it towards cover
fuller ball, clipped away into the vacant spaces on the leg side, to the left of the square leg umpire
good length on the stumps, comes forward and pushes it and the fielder at extra cover does not get down to his right fully and lets it go. Lazy effort
too full, eased down to long-on

short of a length ball, Kamran plays the late cut and places it beautifully, manages to steer it wide of the diving short third man fielder and though it stays in the air, he has placed it perfectly and the ball gets comfortably away from the fielder

gets down to paddle it and uses the pace on Elliott's delivery. Moves across and puts the bat down in time, comes on to him at a comfortable full length and the ball goes away into the fine leg boundary
short and wide, cut square of the wicket, wide of deep backward point
that's a beaut! Superb loopy delivery that lands on leg, pushes the batsman back and spins viciously past the outside edge as he tries to force it through the off side and sticks his bat out
driven out to sweeper cover
short of a length, spinning away wide outside off and it is cut away to sweeper cover
flights it up generously and the ball spins away sharply, The batsman sees the width and tries to cut but it is a tad full and he gets beaten
fuller ball, clipped away to midwicket

goes for an expansive drive and the ball is full and wide. Kamran has to reach out for it and misses out on the drive. The bails are whipped off and the keeper is confident this time. Kamran's foot is outside the crease as the keeper was collecting the bails and he tries to land the foot entirely but it seems as though no part of the shoe is behind the line. It seems like it is on the line and the TV umpire looks at three different angles. It's as close as it gets. And it is given out
full on off, driven to long-on
beats the batsman with sharp turn and bounce outside off
tries to cut abut there is turn and bounce, gets big on him and he cannot make contact
fullish outside off, comes forward and pushes it through point
flat length ball, stays in the crease and tucks it away to deep midwicket
some turn from the back of a length region and Shakib makes further room by backing away before cutting it out to sweeper cover
spins back in from outside off, defended back to the bowler

missed everything has it? Flighted outside off on a fullish length and the ball spins back in a mile. Shakib was looking to drive but it turns from outside off, misses the inside edge, misses the leg stump and misses the keeper as it goes through fine leg
tries to sweep and gets an inside edge to the pad

Very tough caught-and bowled chance, put down. Goes for a straight drive that is partly stopped by the bowler and the ball is eventually fielded at long-on. It was actually a caught-and-bowled and Yasir stuck his hand out but could not hold on to it
tossed up outside off, crunched through extra cover
sliding down leg and the batsman misses the attempted tuck, wears it on the pad as the ball rolls away into the leg side
tries to slog it away and gets an inside edge as the ball goes along the ground to deep square leg
short of a length, not much room but he tries to cut. Does not find the middle of the bat as the ball goes down to third man
short and wide, backs away and slaps and point runs across to his left before diving to stop it
slapped through backward point for a brace
comes down the track and slices it over point. Intention was to go over cover but he does not get to the pitch of the ball
opens the bat face to steer it to third man
short of good length, mistimes a pull from outside off as he sends it wide of midwicket
backs away and cuts to third man

goes for a yorker but instead fires a full toss on the stumps that is picked up off the pads nicely by Shakib. Sails cleanly over deep midwicket and that is the first six of the innings, in the 16th over
walks across to the off side and plays a half-scoop half-pull that goes past short fine leg. The fielder dives but over the ball and cannot stop it
full, wide, throws everything at it and gets a healthy outside edge that flies down towards third man
yorker, wide outside off, Samuels cannot squeeze it out through the off side as he jams the bat down
backs away to make a lot of room but the bowler follows him and the ball is slapped away to deep extra cover

cuts this shorter ball i front of point and they set off for a quick single. The ball is picked up and a direct throw is fired at the bowler's end. They take the overthrow off the ricochet and there is another throw at the keeper's end that narrowly misses the stumps. Could have been gone there if a direct throw was fired

Samuels' painful stay comes to an end. Narine gets one to skid in and Samuels is looking to force it through the off side. Neither forward nor back and ends up making a weal attempt at a cut shot from too close to the body. He misses as the ball crashes into the stumps
pitched up on off side, comes forward and dabs it into the leg side
width on offer outside off, slapped through extra cover
comes forward to meet the pitch and turns this away to the forward short leg region as the bowler darts across to collect it
fullish outside off, 121 kph, drilled down to long-off
full toss outside off, throws his hands hard at it and skews it off the outside edge. The ball goes well inside where the short third man fielder is and into the boundary

angling in on leg stump, Afridi pushes it to covers and takes off for a single. Needless throw fired at the non-striker's end and they take the overthrow as it misses the stumps and there is no one backing up
tries to go big over the off side and ends up slicing it. The ball is in the air and drops in between the lonmg-off and sweeper cover region with two fielders converging in on it
yorker outside off, tries to force it through the off side and gets an inside edge to short fine leg

very full ball, angling in on leg, tries to dig it out into the leg side but gets an inside edge to the pads and the ball rolls into the off side. They take a leg bye as the bowler picks it up on the follow-through
fuller ball, stays in the crease and punches it firmly but straight back to the bowler

Run out chance and it is referred upstairs. And that's gone. Afridi is well short of the crease and the big scoreen flashes the big three red letters much to the dismay of the crowd. Coming to the delivery, it was a fuller ball outside off and Shakib slices it over the backward point region. The ball drops short of the third man boundary and Afridi calls for a third but cannot make it back as the wicketkeeper collects the throw and takes the bails off
shapes up for a pull against this short ball that it is heading down the leg side and called a wide
full and wide, it's a yorker outside off, tries to squeeze it out through the off side and does not make contact
short of good length, Sammy swivels around with the pull shot but messes up the timing and inside-edges it to the pad
short of a length outside off, Sammy flays it hard with an angled bat. But he gets no timing on that at all and the ball lands in front of the mid-off fielder
fullish and angling in on leg stump, Shakib chips it towards long-on and the ball goes on the bounce to the fielder there

full ball and Shakib tries to loft it down the ground. Gets a lot of elevation but not the desired distance as there is not much pace on that delivery. Umar Akmal at long-on settles under it and snaffles it
flicked uppishly into the leg side and the ball goes on the bounce towards the deep square leg fielder running to his left

short ball, swivvels around and pulls and the ball goes to the deep backward square leg boundary. It stays in the air and Ghulam makes a valiant diving attempt as he flings himself to his right but the ball goes straight through the hands
fullish ball outside off, jams the bat down and drills it to wide long-off
full, angling in, Sammy picks it up off the pads and flicks it and the ball sails flat and clean over deep midwicket. That's pure power, no other way to describe that
flays it straight back over the bowler's head and the ball goes to long-off. Wahab sprints back for the second
goes at it with hard hands as he chases a wide ball outside off and sends it to third man off the outside edge
length ball on off, nudged to midwicket
comes down the track and meets the pitch of this fuller ball through mid-on and the ball goes to the left of the fielder there as it goes into the boundary
looks to hit through the leg side but is beaten by pace and wears it on the thigh pad
comes down the track and looks to go big over the off-side, gets a healthy outside edge and the ball goes on the bounce to the fielder at third man who runs to his right and fields it
comes down the track to get on top of this one and flays it over mid-on with a flat bat. Seemed like a catch momentarily but it has sailed well over the fielder there
fired full on off, gets down and sweeps through square leg
comes down the track and meets the pitch of the ball before crunching it down the ground for a straight boundary. The ball goes over the long-on boundary on the bounce
drags the length back and fires this on leg stump. Overcompensates with the length and it is pulled away through the fine leg region

oh, dear. Long-on came up to mid-on and the batsman steps down the track and lofts this cleanly over the fielder who is inside the circle. Comes down early and flicks it straight down the ground. Not much turn on the ball and he is able to easily loft it
backs away to this short ball, waits for this one to spin and come on to him before knocking it through covers
make that five in the over. Pitched up leg stumps, advances down the track and lofts it flat and clean over mid-on
short ball, mistimes the pull to square leg as it hit the high part of the bat
short ball, tries to pull it away but it is pushed across the left-hander and the angle makes it hard for him to make contact as he went at it with his feet rooted to the crease
this time he backs away and tries to pull. It's not as wide this time, in fact too close to pull and hence he makes no contact
backs away and responds with a pull shot to this short ball but he mistimes it and chops towards wide mid-on
finally makes proper connection on the pull shot. Sits up nicely for Delport and he rolls his wrists over it as the ball runs away into the deep backward square leg boundary

well, well, that is some brave bowling. Persists with the short ball and it fetches him reward. He saw Delport taking his eyes off the previous ball late into the shot and probably had the feeling he was not as comfortable against the short ball. So he bangs one in and Delport came down the track and looked to pull. Skies it off the top edge and the wicketkeeper and bowler converge. Hasan says mine and takes a superbly-judged catch. That stayed up for a long time and he did well to get under it
tossed up on leg, pushed back to the bowler

chipped straight down the throat of long-on and Zaman falls for a second-ball duck as Hafeez strikes almost immediately after being brought in. He came down the track and lofted it but did not get hold of it. Cannot clear the boundary as it goes to Wahab Riaz who takes it comfortably. And a mild drizzle had begun even as Zaman is walking off
tries to come forward and flick this away into the leg side but skews it off the leading edge to backward point

yes-and-no and McCullum is back, seems like. Umar came forward and pushed it straight to mid-on. Umar calls McCullum for a run and realises he has hit it straight to the fielder and sends back his captain. All the fielder needed to do was fire a direct hit and he does it superbly and McCullum is a mile out
stays in the crease and turns it away to the midwicket region
fuller, clipped off the pads between midwicket and mid-on

traps him in front and that looked close. Umpire raises his finger and Umar Akmal is on his way back. Just like that four wickets have gone, for the addition of just one run. It was a loopy delivery from Shakib, comes on with the arm on middle and leg channel. It does not turn much and comes on with the arm. Umar was playing for the turn and the ball beats his inside edge and strikes him on the pad. Boy are Lahore unravelling here
sliding in with the arm again and this one spins a lot more, goes off the outer part of the bat as the batsman comes forward to defend and goes into the off side
defended into the covers

looks plumb and gone again. Elliott came forward to play this one but the ball again comes on with the arm and hits him below the shin. That was a lot more plumb than the earlier one. Seemed to be hitting in line with middle. And the rain has arrived again. They are continuing for now, though

stumping chance, referred upstairs. Narine comes forward and expects it to spin. But it does not and he gets beaten as the ball comes on straight and beats the outside edge. The backfoot did not come off and he is safe
gets down to sweep and works it to backward square leg where a brilliant stop is made
short, wide, backs away to make room and cuts through covers, gets it to the left of the fielder there
stays back to this length ball and defends off the inner part of the bat
stays back and defends to the off side

absolute peach from Hafeez. Takes the outside edge. Length ball, Rizwan is forward looking to play for the turn. But it straightens and goes the other way, takes the outside edge, hits him on the back pad and that is a smart, sharp catch by the keeper. Came on to him quickly and he did well to close his hands around it
floats it up on leg, clipped to midwicket where a misfield allows the single
pitched up on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
turning down the leg side and called a wide
opens the bat face and runs it down to backward point
pitched up on middle and Yamin gets down on one knee, slog sweeps into the vacant deep midwicket region as the ball beats the deep square leg fielder running across into the boundary
blocked into the off side
comes forward and pushes it off the front foot to long-off
stays in the crease and tucks it away into the leg side, through the square leg region

shot. Pitched up outside off, offers up enough width for the batsman to free his arms and in the slot for Yamin as he opens up his arms and crunches it straight down the ground. Heaves it muscularly and that goes clean and some distance into the stands
comes down the track and lofts this after getting on top of it straight down the ground as the ball goes on the bounce and over the boundary

pitched up generously and Narine comes down the track to get on top of it before crashing it straight down the ground again. This time the connection is even sweeter and as is the result as the ball crashes into the sightscreen
flat ball, worked to long-off
comes down the track and Hafeez does well to drag the length back forcing the batsman to defend it
switches back to a fullish length and this one's heading down leg after being tossed up. Yamin gets down to slog sweep and the ball goes over deep square leg
slog sweep again and this time the ball goes to the deep backward square leg fielder as he does not make as good connection
short of good length ball, stays in the crease and dabs it away into the leg side
short of a length, tries to tuck it away and is late in closing the face of his bat as the ball skewed back towards the bowler
shorter ball, backs away and opens the bat face to run it down towards third man but does not make contact as he gets cramped for room
uses the pace on that occasion. Length ball, angling away outside off and he drops the wrists late and opens the bat face to steer it to third man
jumps up to deal with the bounce on this one and stabs it to backward point
good length on the stumps, blocked quietly back to the bowler
pushed across to the left-hander from over the wicket. Defended from the crease
driven to long-on
gets down to slog sweep and misses as the ball spins away and beats the batsman. Misses off-stump by inches
opens the bat face and drops it in front of backward point
short and wide, backs away and cuts but Maqsood at backward point makes a brilliant diving save. Slight mix-up in the middle but they get back safely

full and angling in and Narine superbly picks it up off the toes and flicks it away behind square. Asghar at deep backward square leg runs across and dives to his left, just in front of the ropes, to make a stop. They go upstairs to check and he has done fine there
gets it off the outside edge to third man and Tamim Iqbal fails to stop it entirely. Dived to his right and got his hands to it but the ball rolled away with the momentum after he tried stopping it
opens him up with a length ball in the corridor of uncertainty and Narine is beaten as he sticks his bat out. All squared up

and the entertaining partnership comes to an end. You just got the feeling if nLahore were wresting back the momentum and Wahab has struck. Short of a length ball does the trick as Narine tries to get the front leg out the way and pull it. But not enough room to play the shot convincingly as you can see from the stifled follow-through and deep square leg takes the catch
short of good length, defended off the backfoot
short of good length, stabs it to point from the crease
pushed down to long-on
tries to flick it away into the leg side but inside-edges it to the pad
short ball, cut off the backfoot to sweeper cover
tucked off the pads to deep square leg
fuller ball, sliding in, misses the clip and hits the batsman on the toe, heading down leg

that's self-destruction. Lahore are trying to force the issue and it is not working. This one is short and wide and he tries to slap it away. All he can do it slice it to point where Hafeez takes the catck
closes the face of his bat as he tries to flick this length ball into the leg side and the ball takes the leading edge and goes wide of point. Only just
slower full ball, Sammy rolls his fingers over it and Tanvir strides across before bunting it into the off side
full and wide, driven down to long-off off the front foot
good length, just outside off, walks across before turning it away into the leg side
quicker ball on middle stump, defended
floats it up outside off and there is enough room for Tanvir as he launches it over long-on for a clean and straight six
turns it away to deep square leg for a single
pushes this on off and Yasir gets forward to block
length ball, tucked wide of square leg for a quick single
floats it up and pushes it across the left-hander, drilled down to long-off

sees some width outside off and picks up the slower ball early to get in position. Sammy had rolled his fingers over it and it sat up nicely for Tanvir who fetches a pull from outside off and the ball goes between long-on and deep middwicket
slower short of a length ball, steers it to third man
short of a length, angling in on off, gets the front leg out of the way and pats it into the leg side
short ball, controls the pull shot to deep square leg
slower ball again, opens the bat face and steers it through cover-point
short ball, pulled between long-on and deep midwicket. Both fielders converge and deep midwicket picks it up

short ball, tries to fetch a pull from outside off and gets a leading edge as the ball files over the third man boundary. Or has it? It beat the third man fielder but just landed in front of the ropes
good length ball on off, blocked
short of a length, tries to go big over the leg side but the angle takes the ball away from him and he cannot make contact
fuller outside off, drilled down to long-on
length on off, shaping slightly back in, opens the bat face and steers to third man
slower short ball, tries to pull but is too early into the shot and gets beaten
short of good length, angling away, tries to open the bat face and steer it but cannot beat backward point
swings mightily without feet and the ball is pushed across outside off, gets beaten as he swings through the line
short ball, jumps up to ride the bounce before steering it to third man

superb dipping yorker on middle and leg. That looked like a full toss right till the end and Tanvir jams the bat down. Gets an inside edge that goes to the right of the keeper who dives to his right and stops. That was a fantastic yorker
full, wide, yorker again, Tanvir fails to squeeze it out through the off side as he jams the bat down. Nice mixing up of length from Wahab
goes for the slow, dipping yorker again but fires a full toss that is whipped away between deep midwicket and long-on. What an over from Wahab. Just two off it

that's a mile into the stands at long-on. Full, wide, and Tanvir fetches it from way outside off. Drags it over long-on and it has sailed comfortably into the bottom-tier. Can Tanvir do something special here? He's striking the ball well here
wide fuller ball, Tanvir cannot make contact as he attempts to squeeze it out. Umpire does not think it is a wide
fuller on off, goes for a drive and bottom-edges it to the keeper. Got that off the toe end
full and wide, driven square of the wicket. There is a deep point in place but they push back for the second by the time h can get around the ball and fire a throw
short of a length, mistimes the pull to square leg
low full toss outside off, punched down to long-on

wild swing across the line and beaten. Length ball, pushed across to the right-hander from over the wicket and he cannot make contact as he tries to keep the front leg out of the way and heave it away into the leg side
width on offer outside off, stabs it towards mid-off
full and wide, works a late angle away from the left-hander, and Tanvir drills it to mid-off

short of good length and wide outside off. Yasir flays it with a flat bat through mid-ff and Sammy runs back and puts in a vigorous dive. Could have hurt himself as he landed on his wrist there. The ball goes across the ropes nonetheless
short ball, fetches a pull from outside off and he has got hold of this one nicely. The ball sails comfortably over deep midwicket. And that brings up the fifty of the partnership
stays rooted to the crease and swings wildly at this delivery anging away outside off, makes no connection
full toss, flicked off the pads straight to deep midwicket

gets down to slog sweep and does not get any elevation as the ball goes along the ground. The fielder running across from deep midwicket slides with his foot forward instead of diving with his arms outstretched and the ball goes past the boundary
advances down the track to slog and misses the ball altogether. Kamran whips the bails off in a flash. That was quick from Afridi and Yasir was beaten by pace. Nice hand, though
chips this in the air to well to the right of the bowler and the ball goes towards mid-on

what a catch that is from Sammy! He is not sure though and they have to refer that upstairs. Seems like he has hurt his fingers too slightly. . Slogs it from the crease and Sammy runs in and dives forward at long-on. Seems like he has his fingers underneath it but it is touch and go. Not out is the call. It was not convincing and the umpire, not being 100 percent sure, does not give it
short ball, gets big on him and he responds with a hurried pull as the ball goes through midwicket
